posts.post_content:
Started playing last year, pulled Bolas last week at prerelease as my first planeswalker. Never managed to get him out as I either had the mana but not him or him and not the mana. Put him into my G/B ramp deck and added a decent amount of fixing to pay his blue and red cost. Pretty excited to try him out, he seems really fun to play.  
  
Edit: I've managed to get him out now on a semi-regular basis. He's absolutely ridiculous once he hits the field, even if I never pull off his -9. Plus, starting at 5 loyalty keeps him from being easily burnt on arrival. Still, I feel like a huge jerk whenever I manage to get him out because he just trounces people.  
  
  
@PinkMage, you say this card sucks in every way including casual, and yet you bring up Mind Sculptor? I would much rather stare down Bolas than having to deal with Mind Sculptor's carnival of frustration. And why do you berate this one card so terribly? It's like Nicol Bolas killed your parents or something.  
  
Plus, as others have said, part... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
So let's see..  
+3: Kill anything, except creatures. Lord Bolas will not tolerate other people having nice things.  
-2: Steal creature. Because while Bolas hates you, He is not wasteful.  
-9: Screw you.  
If he hits the table, and you can avoid dying immediately, he helps you get so far ahead it's not even funny. Land, enchantments, artifacts, all go away.   
Oh you wanted to swing with your [Sun Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sun Titan)? Nope.  
not to mention his last effect is just devastating in every way. It's pretty much over if you hit someone with it.

Posted By: AwkwardInvasion (12/12/2012 1:22:18 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
His abilities had better have been good! 8 mana, particularly in 3-colours, ISN'T what you'd call "aggressive".  
  
I found that he was the easiest player in the DotP 2013 game, despite being the "end boss"...   
AND HE PLAYED [MOX](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=MOX)S. YOU KNOW, THE EXPENSIVE ONES.   
  
All in all, when M13 was in limited play, he was a weird pick. His $6 price-tag and play-ability in standard (or lack of) wasn't what convinced people to play him. No, people would usually first-pick him JUST IN CASE someone's going grixis colours and might be able to get him out.   
  
Without the Grixis love in Alara, this is and will be a difficult card to get out, always.   
But once you do, oooooh boy. Oh boy. Oh boy oh boy oh boy.
posts.html:
His abilities had better have been good! 8 mana, particularly in 3-colours, ISN'T what you'd call "aggressive".

I found that he was the easiest player in the DotP 2013 game, despite being the "end boss"...
AND HE PLAYED MOXS. YOU KNOW, THE EXPENSIVE ONES.

All in all, when M13 was in limited play, he was a weird pick. His $6 price-tag and play-ability in standard (or lack of) wasn't what convinced people to play him. No, people would usually first-pick him JUST IN CASE someone's going grixis colours and might be able to get him out.

Without the Grixis love in Alara, this is and will be a difficult card to get out, always.
But once you do, oooooh boy. Oh boy. Oh boy oh boy oh boy.

posts.post_content: I've never actually won with him directly. Whenever I drop him my opponent just ends up conceding after I've stripped him of everything he cherishes. You don't win WITH him, you win BECAUSE of him.
